intro: Lonicera tatarica f. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring aromatic, opposite leaves and showy white to pale yellow flowers. The flowers are clustered in terminal racemes and bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. This variety is distinguished by its pale floral coloration, which contrasts with the more common orange or yellow flowers of the species. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in a variety of soil conditions.
